Stephen Smith wrote:
>
> Are you clearing resources in the tearDown associated with each test?
>
> ---
>




Yes, we try to encourage that, not to say that there might not be some 
sloppiness out there,  but JUnit still keeps a reference to an instance 
of the class for each fixture. Since we run over 9000 fixtures we end up 
with 9000 object references.  The root is TestSuite, one instance for 
each addTest() call.  It would be great if after the test runs the 
object was dereferenced, then we could just rely on garbage collection 
to cleanup, both the object reference and any fields allocated.

Kathey
